data.title: University of Connecticut Athletics
data.meta_description:
Madison Cook (12) Attack  - AS A SENIOR (2020): Saw action in one game against Quinnipiac (Feb. 28). 

AS A JUNIOR (2019): Appeared in four games…Tallied a goal
data.text:
AS A SENIOR (2020): Saw action in one game against Quinnipiac (Feb. 28).

AS A JUNIOR (2019): Appeared in four games…Tallied a goal against UNH (Feb. 24)…Picked up four ground balls and forced one turnover.

AS A SOPHOMORE (2018): Made seven appearances … picked up her first career points with two assists in a win at New Hampshire (Feb. 28) … notched her first career goal in a win against Temple (Apr. 7) … finished the season with a personal-best two goals and two assists for four points … collected two ground balls on the season.

AS A FRESHMAN (2017): Saw action in three games … posted one ground ball and one caused turnover … made her collegiate debut against Butler (April 8).

HIGH SCHOOL: Earned five varsity letters at Christian Brothers Academy…served as a lacrosse captain her junior and senior years…helped CBA to two state championship titles and four sectional championships…was named All-CNY as a sophomore…earned three varsity letters in bowling and served as the bowling captain her junior and senior years…had the highest bowling average on the team her senior season and won second place at the league individual tournament that same year…earned honor roll or high honors in every semester of high school…a member of the National Honor Society.
